"You'll be coming by later too right?" she asked the sheep.

"Of course. If Bruno is over at your house I wouldn't miss it. I don't think we've had a big gathering like this since Lindesfare graduated. And besides I want to meet this Amadeus. He sounds fascinating," responded Corrie. Smiling and waving goodbye Kell led the way through the office, which was once again abuzz with activity, most of it kind of bloody as hunters brought in proof of their kills that ranged from a deer's horn to the served head of a squirrel.

"Amadeus is going to love it here," commented Zee. The blood and violence would appeal to his nature as a Gamer, though Zee would have to increase his metabolic rate in order to allow him to ingest his kills. While Kell and her kind were designed to eat a whole deer in a single sitting Amadeus rarely ate more than a ration bar unless he had to. Luckily for the duo the staff was focused on the day's work, and so they got outside without any trouble. Walking up to the car which had brought them there Zee wondered if he could get Kell to give Amadeus a ride into work from now on, as he was still of the opinion that Amadeus did not need to be behind the wheel of such a vehicle.

"I apologize in advance for anything Amadeus has done to your home and culture. He really needs to learn to control himself more," said Zee as Kell started the car and pulled out of the parking lot into the fast moving traffic.

"Oh, you don't have to do that. According to Kevin Amadeus has been getting along quite well with everyone. He even helped a little with a snag in Hare-Link's hardware, patching a cable with that weird gun of his. He then proceeded to beat Fiona and Rudy at video games, which surprised them both," commented Kell with a laugh, remembering how shocked Kevin had seemed at that statement. He had been watching Fiona beat Rudy for years, but Amadeus had apparently trounced them both quite throughly.

"Hmm. Amadeus has a lot of skill at games, both those of the Terminals and the more archaic ones played on disks and cartridges, though I do not believe he has ever had an opponent in the latter as most people prefer the Terminals," said Zee, remembering how Jasmine had played with Amadeus for hours in the Terminal, simulating something called a Nintendo and using a controller interface to play.

"Well he has opponents now, and he beat them badly. I think it is good for them though, as Fiona sometimes needs to learn that there is always someone better than you. Something she proves to Rudy every time they play against each other," responded Kell as they made their way through the traffic. From there the conversation stalled as Kell had to focus on the world around her, dodging in and out of lines of cars that seemed to be ripping down the streets and excessive speeds. Zee defiantly would make sure Amadeus was not allowed to pilot one of these vehicles.

At last, after many hair raising turns they arrived back at the large tree house in which Zee had first become active, and it looked just the same to the CAP as it had the night before, if a little brighter and with more people. Now there seemed to be quite a few vital forms already inside, though his sensors confirmed that only one was really new to him, and it was more than likely Bruno, the wolf boy that Corrie had talked about.

Getting out of the car Zee followed Kell up the drive and went to the door, expecting to find Amadeus leaping about showing off his combat skills he was surprised to find that everything was quiet, and that nothing in the immediate area seemed to have been broken or battered in the last few hours. Opening the door Zee found that everyone was gathered around Amadeus who was...
112212111121221212212.title: Back to Harth and Home for Kell at least

1122121111212212122122.content:
Looking over Kell's shoulder Zee found Amadeus sitting in the middle of a large group of people he recognized from earlier, though many were sitting in different positions. The only unknown was a wolf boy several times Rudy's size sitting next to him and Fiona. Already having surmised that the newcomer had to be Bruno, Corrie's boyfriend if he guessed correctly about her relationship with him, Zee looked next to his brother, who was squeezing the end of a femur in a firm, yet gentle grip, pressing it into an already impressive model that sat in the center of the group.

"What do we have here?" asked Kell, causing all eyes to turn towards the two newcomers. Obviously these people were impressed by Amadeus' marrowmelding technique as they had not even heard the door open to admit the two.

"I'm just demonstrating a bit of art. Coney generously agreed to give me a few bones from her stash so I could preform some marrowmelding," explained Amadeus as he released his grip on the femur to reveal that it had bonded to the rest of the sculpture, becoming part of a large cube shape.

"Marrowmelding?" asked Kell as she took a seat, looking in fascination at the complex shape Amadeus had already constructed from the various bones that Coney, her carnivorous bunny of a daughter, had given him from her growing collection. Most of them were small, forming intricate shapes within the overall image, while larger femurs created the cube's less detailed outer shell.

"Marrowmelding is an ancient art, created a long time ago by the Recom, who honored their dead by creating grand works of art from their bones," explained Amadeus, picking up another bone and placing it next to the large femur, and the squeezing it into place.

"That is Rekos. The Recom were their cousins, and they typically ate their dead," corrected Zee.

"Oh. Well Bit-Brain, how about you give the history lesson while I finish this up," said Amadeus, who had tried to explain the art without success earlier to his audience, and then had decided to simply demonstrate. Zee, knowing his brother's lack of storytelling ability, decided to start at the beginning just to correct whatever other mistakes Amadeus may have made explaining the art.

"Fine then. Marrowmelding is a very old art, and is supposed to be done shortly after an individual has died, when the bone is still soft. The Rekos believed that by doing this, the spirit of a fallen mate or loved one would be preserved forever as a piece of art," began Zee, watching as Amadeus put just a bit to much pressure on the tiny bone he was working on, causing it to shatter in his hand.

"However, even when new the bones are strong, and thus break if you apply too much force to them. Rather you have to allow the bones their own shape, and give them only the force needed to assume the form that lies within them," he continued, watching in amusement as Amadeus reached for a bone of similar shape and size to the one he'd broken, yet placing it on an entirely different place in the cube.

"To the Rekos there s no higher honor than to have their bones preserved in this way, though many cultures that meet them consider the art form somewhat morbid, due to the unease associated with life termination," he told the group, who listened and watched with great fascination as Amadeus pulled away his hands, revealing that the small bone now connected the larger cube to one that was contained within.

"As you can see, when done properly marrowmelding lives up to the name it was given, literally fusing the marrow of two bones together. This is done by applying an exact amount of force, as too much breaks them, but too little will leave them with an unfused form. It makes the art a difficult thing to master. Many spend lifetimes studying it. Amadeus spent over forty years learning the art himself, from Jygo-ris, a woman considered to be the greatest of the greats," Zee informed his audience, but the information seemed to startle the artist most of all as Amadeus dropped the bone he had been about to place in the sculpture and look over at his companion.

"What do mean forty years? I'm not that old," complained Amadeus as he picked back up the bone, placing it atop the inner cube, connecting it to the outer.

"You are to these people. We have to start thinking in new terms Amadeus. Shift from Trade Standard measurements of time and space to their's. That means meters to feet. Cycles to hours, and our years are about twenty one of their's, making you just a little over four-hundred-twenty-six," Zee told Amadeus, which caused him to shrug a bit in recognition of the change. The other's took the news of Amadeus' age a bit more harshly, most of them looking to Danielle who was the resident expert on humans, but she seemed just as shocked.

"Your over four hundred years old?" asked Danielle at last, having taken a moment to process the information.

"According to Zee, who I trust in matters like this," responded Amadeus, not the least bit concerned that his age seemed to be causing a bit of a stir among his audience. Danielle was again the first to recover, having assumed that Amadeus was older than he appeared anyway, as she knew humans had been trying to expand their lifetimes, and Amadeus' humans had, had a few thousand years to make them even longer than the hundred years that was the limit on her world when she'd left it.

"You look good for someone that age," she commented, not sure what else to say. Most of the others, who were used to much shorter life spans, were still having trouble believing that the creature before them could survive that long.

"Thanks, I do try and take care of myself," said Amadeus as he added yet another bone to the sculpture. Unseen by anyone save Amadeus Coney had crawled her way over to him and proceeded to rummage through he pile of bones at his left. She seemed to pick one at random, holding it out to Amadeus, who looked at it and nodded, taking it and placing it among the others.

"You've got quite an eye for art, Coney. Maybe you would like to learn this," said Amadeus as he pressed the bone into the piece, and then without an warning backed off, allowing Coney to pick up one of the bones and crawl over to the cube. Delicately she placed the bone at the bottom edge, and was about to press it in when suddenly another place caught her eye, and she shifted her place, putting the bone at an angle to where she'd been about to place. Amadeus, who was sitting back in a lotus position looked at her placement and smiled.

"Very good eyes," he commented softly, leaning forward and placing his hand over her's, helping her to place the bone into the art. Together they both stood and he walked around the cube within a cube, while Coney hopped at his feet, before returning to Kevin's lap. Everyone, still reeling a bit from the revelation of Amadeus' age was now staring at the art, and slowly they nodded in satisfaction.

"It's beautiful," commented Fiona at last, reaching out to touch it lightly, as if to make sure it wasn't some smoke vision.

"Quite interesting. A real tesseract made of bones. Some would say that you just combined high art and high science. Blasphemous really," commented Zee as he walked around the cube-within-a-cube shape that Amadeus and Coney had just completed.

"Only to those who worship one or the other. Personally I think they go quite will together if you give them a chance," responded Amadeus as he joined Zee staring at his sculpture from a distance. The others, who were still marveling at the shape were just beginning to notice that no matter where they moved their heads the cube inside the larger one seemed to remain stationary, as if it moved with them. Lindesfare, a student of science, would have recognized the term tesseract from her classes, but the others, who were not nearly as well versed in such things, were left to wonder what it was specifically.

"What's a tesseract?" asked Fiona at last, as she stared into the almost infinite depth of the two cubes.

"A tesseract is to a cube, what a cube is to a square. It is a four dimensional shape that is expressed within a three dimensional universe by placing a cube within a cube," explained Zee.

"And I think I should go wash off my hands before I do anything else, as I seem to have gotten marrow all over them. If you will excuse me," said Amadeus, moving around the crowd, most of which ignored him as they stared into the sculpture, just as he'd intended. Zee looked after him with some concern before following Amadeus to a rear portion of the house where the bathroom was located. He found Amadeus already soaking his hands, and as he stepped through the door he heard Amadeus' hand go to his belt and begin to rummage for something. A moment later he pulled out...
1122121111212212122122.title: Tesseracts and Ages

11221211112122121221222.content:
The weapon, which had appeared like a flat, shiny, chrome version of the projectile pistols on which it's design was based was still simple to look at, all except for the ball at the end where the hammer was on an old fashioned pistol. Before the ball had appeared to be smooth an chrome like the rest of the weapon, but now it glowed with an inner light that seemed to be rippling, as if trying to break out of the prison of tech in which it was contained.

"You have already started it," commented Zee in the Combine Trade language, looking over his shoulder to make sure none of their hosts had gotten suspicious and followed the pair. Amadeus remained silent as he gazed back down the hall as well, and then slowly shut the door and locked in so that the two were in the bathroom alone.

"Yes. I told you I would. Now, how did your exploration go?" asked Amadeus, using that same language, which sounded much like musical tones, and would have been incomprehensible to the people of the planet, who had never heard the language before.

"I discovered much about this world, and its people. As you surmised they have an Internet much like that of old Earth, or the one which connects the various Archives of the Combine," responded Zee, looking at the weapon in Amadeus' hand with concern.

"You accessed it then?" inquired Amadeus, who stared at the weapon with a look of concern himself, but he seemed to be less nervous about it than Zee.

"Yes. I can confirm the story now. The avian lifeforms accessed the Vault shortly after humans left the planet. Inside they found those technologies that were deemed to unstable to carry with the Arks across space. Of course the avians had no real understanding of what they'd discovered, mistaking many of the items for other things," said Zee.

"Like thinking the Tempus was a time-machine rather than a quantum-waveform manipulator," said Amadeus as he nodded his head, understanding how such errors would have occurred.

"Yes. As far as they know they found a bunch of junk humans left behind because they couldn't take it with them. They never had any inkling of the real reason such things were left behind," explained Zee, still eyeing the weapon. For a moment it seemed he might try to rip it out of Amadeus' hand, but Amadeus gripped the weapon to tightly to allow the CAP any hope of getting it away from him in time.

"So they don't know what they found?" asked Amadeus, tapping the point f his gun on the counter at his side.

"Exactly. Now turn it off Amadeus," said Zee in a pleading tone.

"You know I can't do that Zee. So don't ask," responded Amadeus, pulling the gun closer to himself in a protective manner.

"Yes you can. You always tell me you have a choice. You choose what you do. Well you are making a wrong choice here!" said Zee, in a shouted whisper so that it would not alert anyone else to the drama unfolding inside a bathroom.

"Orders are orders Zee. This isn't about emotions. I don't want to do this, but unless you can give me a reason not to, then it has to be done," said Amadeus in a flat tone.

"Just following orders has not been a viable excuse for millennia. And if you want a reason then look around. Do these people look like they have access to things that can destroy the universe?" said Zee again using a vehement whisper, this time gesturing towards the door and their hosts beyond it.

"They may not, but that doesn't mean others don't. Zee, if you me to turn this off, you have to give me a reason that I can use, not just some emotional heart tugs," responded Amadeus, watching as the small sun in the ball at the back of his gun began to shift colors from a bright red to a neon orange.

"You are asking me to prove a negative Amadeus, and I can not do that! No one can. I already told you I do not detect anything from the Vault active on this planet," said Zee, staring at the gun's sounding chamber with a look of horror.

"You don't have to prove it Zee. You just have to tell me that you're slagging sure that there is no danger from it. Now did the story check out, did the birds send everything into the future?" demanded Amadeus, raising his own voice as he watched the neon orange color shift to bright yellow.

"No they did not. They think they did because they think the Tempus is a time machine. What they did has eliminated the Vault techs. I have their list, and it has an entry for everything they found. The names are different, but I believe with all my logic string that it is everything we left behind," responded the CAP, beginning to sweat as the gun changed again, this time to a burning white. Only moments remained now before it went off.

"So you think that the Vault techs are gone. That is your assessment?" asked Amadeus, much more calmly than Zee felt the situation warranted.

"Yes! Now please turn it off Amadeus!" said Zee, shouting now as the white began to become black, the heat of the weapon consuming even light now.

"You're not lying to save them are you Zee? I know how you feel about this. I know what you would do to protect this place, but as a citizen of the Combine it is your duty to give me accurate information. An Admiral needs to trust his people, and right now I need to trust you. Zee are you worthy of my trust?" asked Amadeus, staring into the ever deepening void of his weapon.

"No I am not lying. Now please Amadeus, shut it off!" commanded Zee as the weapon began to emit a high pitched whine. Amadeus had a choice now. He could believe Zee was telling the truth, and that he didn't have to do what he was planning on doing, or he could let the gun finish its work, and make sure that this was ended now. Does he believe Zee?
11221211112122121221222.title: An issue of trust

112212111121221212212221.content:
Placing his hand on the back of the gun Amadeus sighed and turned the top half of the ball a quarter inch to the right, and instantly the ball transformed into the chrome coloring of the rest of the weapon, and the whine went away. Zee, having almost given in to his impulse to attack Amadeus and take the weapon by force, sighed heavily and slammed into one of the walls, sliding into a siting position and wiping his brow, clearing off a few trickles of sweat. Amadeus, noticing the sweat for the first time noted that Zee shouldn't have had any sweat glands in his current form. Obviously the whole incident had truly gotten to Zee, and Amadeus put his arm around the CAP as he sat down beside him.

"I believe you, Zee. For what it's worth. I believe you," he told his brother, who looked at him with a relieved expression.

"I am glad for that Amadeus. I really am. I still cannot believe what you just tried to do though," commented the CAP as he stared into the human's eyes. Amadeus, having taken hours to do what he'd just done, nodded. He couldn't believe it either, but he was a member of the Combine military, and his orders regarding Earth, and the Vault techs, were quite clear.

"Then think of it as a dream Zee. That always makes things like that easier," said Amadeus, remembering past instances that he wished had really been just dreams, though he knew they were real as he was.

"CAPs don't dream, brother. One of the few things you can do that I cannot, but I will try to understand your actions as best I can. I think we should get back to the others now. Your sculpture may be good, but it will not keep them distracted much longer," observed Zee, getting up and walking towards the door. Outside he could hear a few murmurs already coming down the hall. The gathered vital forms had just noticed that the two visitors were no longer among them. Trying his best to put on a smile Amadeus followed Zee in going out the door, and once more into the home which he'd just nearly vaporized.

"Come on Zee. You know why I did it, and you know that it is necessary," said Amadeus in the Trade Language again, making sure that Zee would not be able to respond in kind as they entered the living room where eyes were now turned towards them.

"Where did you two get off to?" asked Kevin as the two resumed their positions beside the marrowmeld tesseract.

"We had a discussion about what Zee learned on his day. Some very interesting stuff," said Amadeus, telling a half truth, which was a still a lie.

"I would say so. After he hacked the Internet wide open and did work that would have taken Corrie months," responded Kell. Trying to act like he already knew about that Amadeus chuckled slightly and nodded.

"Yes, he said something about that, though truth to tell I was more interested in the social commentary, as I will have to at least try and blend in tomorrow," said Amadeus, who had been discussing plans with the Dewclaw's earlier about going into town and looking for a job.

"Well, blending in isn't going to be easy for you. Herd Thinners isn't exactly a kind place to work, even for people like myself, and for someone without any natural weapons or defenses it will be even harder I imagine," commented Kell, getting a few sidelong glances from everyone around her.

"What do you mean?" asked Danielle before anyone else could.

"Zee said he hacked our records and gave Amadeus an employee file. According to him he created a past that says he is a distant cousin of ours, and that he and Amadeus have been living on an island far away," said Kell. Because of certain cultural differences only Danielle seemed to find the past odd, though she did not comment on it, feeling that she could discuss it with Amadeus alone later.

"That is the basics of what my alterations state," confirmed Zee as the others looked at him.

"So I guess we really are here to stay then, huh Zee?" said Amadeus in a depressed tone, as if him being employed made their situation any different from where it had been when he'd let Zee wander while he slept.

"Yes Amadeus. We really are in an E.T.E. now. So you better start getting used to it," responded Zee, his tone only slightly less dreary than that of Amadeus. The others, even these that really had only a base understanding of what was going on, found their moods dipping to new lows.

"What's an E.T.E.?" asked Rudy, not seeming to feel the darkness that hung in the air, and getting a shoulder in his gut from Fiona who looked at him with venom in her eyes. Amadeus looked down at his feet for a moment before looking over at Zee, motioning with his hand that he should explain. Zee didn't look to eager to do so, but sighing he turned so that everyone could see his face.

"An E.T.E. is a three letter acronym for Extra-Terrestrial Event. The Combine, our government, is quite old, and large, so times when citizens find themselves stuck on a populated world with no way to return home have happened in the past. Because of this there are certain rules that have grown out of previous experiences," explained Zee, putting his hands out before him and projecting shafts of light above his head. Forming out of the shafts was a screen that displayed Trade Standard Language text before shifting to English when his translator kicked in.

"One, any citizens who find themselves in such a situation are required to blend in with the local population as much as possible, to avoid affecting the culture of the natives through religious misconceptions," read Zee aloud as the text moved across his projected screen. Amadeus beside him let out a chuckle and lightly tapped him on his arm.

"Now that one never seems to work out. Remember Qourk Thela where they thought you were a ‘Spirit Beast' and I was a ‘Child of Heaven'?" asked Amadeus, and Zee looked at him like a father scolding a misbehaving child. Coughing embarrassedly Amadeus stepped back and allowed Zee to continue.

"Two, any citizen in such a situation is to limit themselves to technology that the culture is able to develop itself, except when circumstances of personal safety become an issue," read Zee. Again Amadeus stepped forward, but this time instead of trying to talk to Zee he faced the group.

"What that means is we aren't allowed to build anything that you can't yourselves, unless for some reason this whole planet is threatened by something, and then we are allowed to do whatever we deem necessary to prevent it," explained Amadeus, looking over at Zee to see if he said it right. Zee nodded at him, and so Amadeus smiled in triumph as he stepped back behind the CAP.

"And finally, Three, any citizen involved in an E.T.E. is to use their own judgement regarding dissemination of information regarding their origins, but is advised to keep any knowledgeable individuals informed of their circumstances only as long as assimilation requires," stated Zee, closing both his hands and causing the light shafts to shut down.

"That means that Amadeus and I are allowed to tell whoever we want about what we are, but we are supposed to get as far away as possible from anyone we tell, to avoid violating rule one," explained Zee, smiling as he stepped back beside Amadeus who had been about to step forward and explain it himself.

"Which we won't do, mostly because we didn't really have to tell anyone anything. You guys already knew about humans, and besides, this is Earth. The homeworld. I think this qualifies as a unique situation," said Amadeus, both to the group, and to Zee.

"All E.T.E.s are unique. Though I will admit that this one is highly unusual," responded Zee, talking to Amadeus and not the group. Everyone else seemed to be a bit stunned by the new information, and the fact that their new guests actually had rules of conduct that basically told them to try and be like everyone else. Looking over at the two everyone was of the opinion that Zee could fit in fine, but Amadeus would be hard to hide, even if his personality weren't so outgoing. At that instant the front door burst open and into the Dewclaw home came...

1122121111212212122122211.content:
"Hello, any one home?" asked the sheep girl as she entered the Dewclaw home, and without hesitation Bruno leaped up from his seat and went over to embrace Corrie. Rudy, still sitting next to Fiona, rolled his eyes and sighed, but straightened up when his own girlfriend looked ready to elbow him in the gut again. Corrie pushed Bruno off her, giving the wolf boy a quick kiss as she did so and soliciting a rude noise from Rudy, who, as promised, got an elbow jammed in his gut.

"Hello Corrie, so how was your day with Zee?" asked Fiona, trying to cover up for Rudy's actions. Corrie was silent for several seconds as she looked around the room, finding it to be full of her family and relations, including her latest ‘cousin' Zee, who sat on the floor by a very interesting looking sculpture made of what she thought were bones.

Her eyes were drawn, however, to the individual sitting next to Zee. See recognized almost instantly that he was human, both from Rudy's old comic, and pictures of her step-mom after she had become human thanks to a kind of doorway that went to a world full of them. His form was very similar to those around, if a little less furry, but his eyes were much different.

Where the eyes of the others all held a kind of primal feel to them, his were focused, and alert, seeing the world in a way the others couldn't. Corrie remembered that she herself had found only four other sets of eyes like that, three of them in the room now. One was Danielle, a former human and Lindesfare, who was also a former human according to what Rudy had told Bruno. The others two sets belonged to people of her world, but ones Zee had said were more human than most, and they were her's and Coney's.

"Greetings and salutations, Corrie. I apologize for anything Zee might have done to make your work harder. I know he can be a bit of a handful," said Amadeus, holding his hands before him so that they folded into an S-shape from her perspective, and then bowing deeply to her. Rising he smiled at her and winked before resuming his seat. Not sure how to take the gesture Corrie stood silent for a few moments, looking around again to try and find some answers before deciding that she was better off just making her own.

"You don't have to do that. Zee didn't make my work any harder. In fact thanks to him it was several hundred times faster than it would have been. He fixed the entire network at Herd Thinners in minutes," proclaimed Corrie, and Kevin, Ralph, and the others who had been working at Hare-Link stared at the CAP in amazement. They had been dealing earlier that day with their own scrambled files, which had been miraculously fixed by some outside force, which they could now put a name and face too.

"You didn't just do their files, did you?" asked Kevin, wanting to confirm his suspicions before he went any farther. Zee looked at the rabbit man for a moment, before simply nodding. Amadeus seemed much more enthusiastic about the information, slapping his hand on Zee's back, pushing him forward slightly.

"I told you Kevin. Zee excels at programing. He could help your ISP go a thousand times faster," inserted Amadeus, smiling at Zee, who didn't look that thrilled to learn that his companion had been bragging about his skill.

"I could do that, yes, but I have to ask why you informed them of my capability," said Zee, staring at Amadeus, his expression stony and unreadable to anyone.

"For the same reason you created files in this Herd Thinners place for me, a job. Right now we need employment in order to acquire material necessities, including room and board," responded Amadeus.

"You need room and board. I require no such thing," commented Zee, creating an icy chill in the air.

"That's not entirely true Zee, and you know it. Listen, as it is, Tree is free right now. Lindesfare and Fenton with both return to their university soon, and so they have a spare home, which I had hoped to borrow while we get some feet under us. Once we're up and standing we can start walking on our own two legs, but until then..." said Amadeus. He had discussed his plans with both Tree and the Dewclaw family, and most agreed that it was a good idea, though they would have to ask Fenton when he awoke later, s legally Tree was his home.

Thinking of Fenton, Amadeus remembered that he had been sleeping in their home, and had not bothered to awaken them when he'd left, which might cause some concern when they awoke and found him gone. Looking out at the sunset through a nearby window he knew they would be up and about soon.

"On that note, I think I should get back to Tree. I don't want either Lindesfare or Fenton to wake up and find their house guest mysteriously vanished," he told the group, most whom were looking out the window and found the late hour surprising, especially considering they had gotten little sleep the night before thanks to the blackout.

"That might not be a good idea Amadeus. I still want to try and avoid you influencing the local culture until tomorrow, or rather until I can give you a crash course on local customs. Perhaps it would be best if one of the others goes and grabs the two," suggested Zee, motioning towards the assembled group. Amadeus, not one to hide, had many objections ready for such an argument, but he wondered if maybe Zee was right and that he should remain hidden until the CAP could give him advice on the local culture. Staring out into the sunset he said at last...
1122121111212212122122211.title: Standing on their own two feet

11221211112122121221222112.content:
"I was after all able to get here without that much problem," commented Amadeus to Zee.

"How did you do that anyway? I would think you would stand out here like a sore thumb," responded Zee, truly wondering how Amadeus managed to make his way from Tree to the Dewclaw home without causing a major stir.

"I studied," stated Amadeus, not elaborating further to his companion, or the assembled group. Kevin had been the first to find the human in the home, having not even heard him open the door and come in, so no one really knew how Amadeus had made his way from Tree to his current residence. Instead of speaking on the matter Amadeus instead got up and walked to the door, where he picked up the cloak and helm he'd been wearing when he'd come to Earth.

"But this time I think my old costume would be better. It comes off a lot easier than mud," said Amadeus, looking at Zee and tapping his nose. Zee, who had not considered Amadeus to have been paying that much attention to his surroundings. Considering what he'd nearly done not paying attention would probably have been a good idea for him, as it would have made the action easier.

"I get it," said Zee, and many of the others were dumbfounded by the information that seemed to pass between the two, without any word or signal. As always they turned to their resident expert on humans, Danielle, but she was just as confused as they were by whatever it was that had just been understood by Zee.

"What do you get, may I ask?" she queried at last, looking at Zee with a probing gaze.

"Amadeus used an old hunter's trick. He covered his body in mud to mask his natural scent and then kept out of sight coming over here. Since most...well most animals tend to rely on smell rather than sight they never caught him. Ingenious really, and something I should have thought of myself," said Zee, admonishing himself for his lack of ingenuity, and at the same time he tried to think of ways to say what he thought without causing a stir among his hosts, most of whom did not catch the somewhat derogatory comment that had been aimed at them.

"Yes, but mud is a bit of a mess, both getting on and getting off, so my Norse warrior costume should work just as well. It is Fenrir's hair after all, and it still has his scent on it," explained Amadeus, who could detect the odor of the Great Wolf in the fur, even with his inferior human nose. To the others the scent had to be even more pungent.

"Who's Fenrir?" asked George, who remembered Danielle mentioning that name once in connection with Kell. She had asked him if Kell were a descendent of him as a joke, though when her fox of a husband had stared at her blankly she had shrugged it off.

"Fenrir is a god on my world. He is a huge wolf, with fangs like swords, and claws that can rend mountains. I assume that that is the Fenrir your talking about," inserted Danielle, wanting to try and establish her own knowledge about humans, and to confirm that Amadeus' people really did have the same base as her own.

"Well, sort of. Fenrir is the son of Loki, but not really a god per say. His brother, the Midgard Serpent, was much more powerful in terms of the miracles and stuff, but yeah, Fenrir is a huge wolf thing. I killed it the Game I was playing and came away with a new fur coat," said Amadeus without thinking, not even caring if his talking of killing a wolf would upset his audience.

Zee however did care, but was relieved to see that none of the lupines in the group so much as raised an eyebrow in anger, though since they didn't have eyebrows that would have been hard in and of itself. Instead they seemed to be caught on the fact that Amadeus claimed to have slain a wolf, and then skinned the beast. Zee watching Amadeus proudly don his cloak and clip the helm to it decided that maybe he needed to be knocked down a peg and decided to prove Amadeus' words, while at the same time hitting him in the pride.

"As I remember it Amadeus, you got a much larger fur coat during that experience, but decided it did not fit quite right," interjected Zee, holding out his hands again and projecting yet another image into the air over his head. This image quickly resolved into two distinct forms. One looked to be about the size of Coney, but looking even more like a predator than she did, with a true wolf appearance to it walking on all fours and growling at a little ant that was shouting at it from the base of one of its paws. The ant shouted up at the gigantic beast, and it was clearly trying to threaten it, even though it didn't even come up over the wolf's toes.

"Surrender now and I'll go easy on you!" shouted the ant-like figure at the titanic monster. Slowly the scene began to zoom in on the figure and so Amadeus standing hip deep in snow staring up at Fenrir and brandishing his axe like it could hurt the thing. The wolf, unable to see anyone around looked in every direction for a moment before turning down to face the tiny bug at its feet.

"OH AND JUST WHAT WILL YOU DO IF I DON'T?" said the voice of the wolf, booming compared to that of Amadeus. Not backing down even against a beast like Fenrir Amadeus cried his fury and struck at the monstrous paw before him, which seemed to amuse Loki's son as he laughed at the puny human, flicking it away with a light gesture.

"AWAY WITH YOU MORTAL. MANY MATTERS ARE AFOOT THAT YOU CANNOT BEGIN TO GRASP," proclaimed the wolf, baring his mighty fangs at the intruder who had dared violate his land.

"And what will you do if I don't?" said Amadeus, repeating the tone of Fenrir perfectly. For some reason his mimicking made the wolf's hackles raise in vehement anger, and it brought it's maw closer to the pathetic mortal who had dared repeat his own words back to him. The group watched in fascination and horror as the wolf stuck out its tongue and literally lapped Amadeus up, swallowing him whole like the bug he was.

"That wasn't very bright. Your brother is really trying to get himself killed," said a new voice, this one female. The view shifted and now focused on someone right next to the recorder, a young woman with fiery red hair and green eyes who was wearing only a few scrapes of clothing despite the fact that she was laying in snow.

"Do not be concerned, Amadeus Ex Machina is the hero of the Battles of Dreka and Golodrom Core. He has a plan, that I'm sure of," said a voice that was obviously that of the recorder, and equally obviously Zee.

"I sure hope so," said the woman quietly, looking back over towards the wolf, who as the view shifted back over it, was again standing still as a statue in the snow.

"According to the game rules Fenrir is supposed to stand there and guard the pass to a mountain. Unfortunately our party at the time had no weapon capable of piercing its skin. Quite a conundrum really, but Amadeus bulled his way through as usual, and came up with this idea without consulting any of us. Watch," said the real Zee, zooming in on a piece of the wolf's underbelly. The image stayed focused on that area even as the wolf began wobble, and slowly tip over, dead before it even hit the ground.

As everyone, including a very mad looking Amadeus watched that section of the wolf's belly began to bulge slightly, and then it burst open, letting spill gallons of blood, as well as a very dirty looking Amadeus. The figure sputtered and coughed as it emerged from the inside of the gigantic beast, tripping over a bit of flesh that got caught on his boots. Ripping it off with all his strength Amadeus pulled not only his boot free, but a large section of fur as well, which had the same pattern as the cloak he was now wearing.

"And that lady and various others, is why Amadeus is not allowed to work on his own anymore," said Zee in the recording, and the image bobbed up and down as he and the woman both ran up to grab his brother who was covered in various internal gunk from the wolf. Still coughing he looked up at Zee specifically and wagged his finger at the CAP.

"You owe me a bowl of Spice Soup later. I told you we didn't need to go after that damned magic sword to kill this thing," said Amadeus weakly, before his face fell into the snow with a crunch. The image faded quickly after that and the others looked at each other for a moment, their eyes shifting from one member of their group to another before every eye, including Zee's was focused on Amadeus who was wrapped up in his cloak and helm, which hid most of his body as well as his face.

"You know, you never did pay up for that Zee," commented Amadeus at last, seeming to be unaffected by the memory he had just seen. Zee, for his part, did not laugh or even crack a smile, but everyone could feel a sense of amusement radiating from the CAP as he stared at Amadeus across the room. Before anyone could quite recover from the new information though Amadeus trotted over to the door and looked back at Zee.

"Are you coming, or are you going to stay here and tell more embarrassing stories about me?" asked the human, and Zee smiled this time, unable to hide his own childlike delight at tormenting Amadeus. Not needing any more answer Amadeus stepped out the door and began his trek towards Tree. So do we go with Amadeus, or stay with Zee and the extended Dewclaw family?
11221211112122121221222112.title: Combine's most embarrassing home videos

112212111121221212212221121.content:
Walking with an air of agitation Amadeus made his way through the woods and roads that led to Tree, the same woods and roads he'd traveled three times now. Once running away from the Dewclaws in the dark morning, and the next going back to their home with them as his allies, if not friends, and then finally a few hours ago when he'd awoken and decided to explore on his own and not awaken the pair who were sleeping in Fenton's room, the bat himself hanging on a pole, and Lindesfare sleeping in a bed below that.

Those three times though he had been more focused on getting away, on the people accompanying him, and then on not getting seen respectively. Now though his attention could be dedicated at least partially to the world around him, and he had to admit that his ancestors had been right. This world was beautiful, more so than any other he remembered. He'd seen so much of the universe, and even explored the other infinite realms beyond that, but never before had he seen such majesty as the towering oaks, and azure skies.

Every other place had felt isolated and alien to him, but here, for some reason that he couldn't fathom, he felt he belonged. An odd sensation considering just a few days ago he hadn't believed this planet existed, that it was a fabrication made to bind the Combine together. Odder still when he thought of the fact that through his actions this world had almost been lost again but minutes earlier. As he'd told Zee then, it had been his duty, and he would have fulfilled it without hesitation then, but now, standing among the grass and tress of what he knew to be his people's old home, he didn't thin he could ever bring himself to follow that order, or any other.

Not that he'd have to. Despite what Zee thought Amadeus understood his situation perfectly well. There was little chance that he'd ever get home. All the signs pointed to him dying miserable and alone on a world that had been abandoned eons ago by his forebearers. Those brave men and women, who tried many, many times to save their home, only to have every plan fail, and every device turn against them, until finally the only safe haven left was the cold and pitiless stars.

Now here he stood, a member of that proud race, back after so long away, only to find that in his absence others had taken root. He had little doubt that Zee's word was true. The avians were descendants of Morpheus, one of the final four plans to save the Earth so long ago, and yet another one that had eventually turned against man, driving him to farther extremes. Amadeus wondered again why his ancestors, believing the Vault Techs to be too dangerous to take with them, and left them behind rather than destroy them.

Probably out of some foolish notion of returning one day and trying to restore their home again, he thought, but he would never have the chance to ask. Zee, when he'd spoken to him through the Dance Language, had found nothing in the Archive that explained the odd decision. Thinking back on the battle that morning he laughed, wondering if any of his hosts would ever figure out that Zee and he had not been fighting, but rather communicating in a secret art, trading information in such a way that no one could ever guess what had been said, as the dance language required that one be on the receiving end of the blows so that they knew how much force had been behind each punch.

Looking around Amadeus caught sight of a deer in a suit, walking along the paths himself. Not wanting to draw attention to himself Amadeus walked by the deer without batting an eye, and the deer did the same to him. Obviously the relationship between the prey and hunter types on this world were somewhat different than he'd heard from the Dewclaws, though he would wait until Zee told him the specifics of his new role at this Herd Thinners place before making any judgements.

From Rudy he'd learned that his mother was a top hunter at the company, quite skilled at taking down prey and devouring it. Amadeus had hoped to observe a hunt himself, but apparently they did it as work or sport only now. Hunting just for food did seem a bit of a hassle when they had markets and other businesses which would do it for them. He would just have to wing it tomorrow on his first hunt, and hope that his skill at combat and various other abilities were enough to get him through.

At last arriving at Tree he looked around to make sure he'd attracted no undo notice, and was pleased to find that no one seemed to be paying any attention to him at all. Some odd looking, yet still human creatures, were making their way home after a long day's work, and he noted only one or two stared at him, and then turned back to their own business. Smiling under the wolf shaped helm he opened the door, which had been left unlocked earlier that morning, and when he'd eft he hadn't bothered locking it. He wondered for a moment if he might already be too late and that Fenton and Lindesfare might already be awake and agitated by his disappearance, but not able to hear anything through the heavy doors he opened them, and was instantly greeted by a voice he recognized as...
112212111121221212212221121.title: Human musings about Earth and History

1122121111212212122122211212.content:
"You're late," complained the voice of Tree from one of her many speakers. Amadeus could tell from the tone and volume of her that the Fenton and Lindesfare were still asleep, as Tree said the words quite pointedly, yet kept them to a whisper.

"I know, but I got detoured," Amadeus offered, rubbing the back of his head searching for the catch to the helmet that kept it buckled to the cloak. Finding it at last he undid it with a simple click, and let the hot cloak fall away.

"For three hours?!" she shouted at him with a whisper which Amadeus feared might awaken the slumbering pair. Amadeus was still unsure of Tree's senses, though he had discussed with her a bit about it before leaving. According to Tree she had no sense of sight, and only a slight sense of taste and smell, but her touch was such that she could feeling the vibrations of the air, hearing things with her whole body, which allowed her a kind of echolocation, much resembling Fenton's own radar, but even more sensitive. With senses like that she would know how loud she could be and not disturb Fenton or Lindesfare, and she would be able to hear him no matter how softly he spoke, so he walked up to one of the speakers that was her voice and spoke directly to it.

"Yes, three hours. I wandered for less than ten minutes before finding my way back to that house from this morning. The Dewclaws were home, and I got to talking with them. We had a lot to discuss, me being new here and all, so it should be no surprise that I lost track of time," he retorted, and Tree took a moment to digest this information.

"I understand that, but I was worried. Fenton told me to keep an eye on you before he went to bed, and that's hard enough with you here, let alone wandering," said Tree, her agitation fading. Amadeus had to admit, he'd promised the sentient flora that he would be gone only a few minutes, and he would have to, had not Kevin discovered him in his home. Amadeus berated himself again for getting caught, but he had to admit he was glad he had been, as he'd learned more than a little about his new home from the Hare-Link day staff and company.

Which included both Kell's mom, and for some reason Ralph's wife. Elanor, Kell's mother, lived with her daughter, so there was no real surprise at her presence, but Martha, who was Ralph's wife and Fiona's mother, didn't really have any reason to be there. As she had that morning, the fox woman had stared at him. It hadn't been a mean look in her eyes, or an accusing one, just one that made Amadeus nervous to be in her sight. Luckily Martha had softened up once the discussion had begun, and she'd even cracked a smile at one of his observations which everyone had taken for a joke, though really it hadn't been.

"You knew where I was, I'm sure, and besides, what was the worst that this planet could throw at me?" said Amadeus. Tree had warned him before leaving about local predators and their tricks, but Amadeus had passed off her warning, telling her that he could deal with it, and he had. Using a bit of water he'd coated his polymer-weave suit in mud and that had killed his natural scent, which made him nearly invisible to the local population.

"Yes, but that didn't mean you were safe. I'm sure you think you can take care of yourself, spaceman, but you shouldn't dismiss the locals so easily. I've seen some of the things they do," observed Tree, shuddering at how Kevin had once ripped into an old flower bed. The carnage he'd wrought had taken months to heal.

"I'm sure their violent in their own way, but I'm a trained combat operative, and besides, at one gee these people never develop anything like my strength," commented Amadeus, wishing he could take his suit off, as it served not only to keep him comfortable, but to keep him from hurting himself in the lighter gravity of the planet. Used to walking in Dedros' three point nine gees, and to training in much higher gravity environment, Amadeus was confident he could take anything that had developed on this planet.

"Well, just don't die on my watch. Fenton is very interested in you, and I would hate to have to tell him his new friend got himself eaten before you two had a chance to talk," she told him, and then promptly fell silent, having nothing more to discuss with him. Not one to try and talk to someone who didn't want to talk Amadeus went back to the sofa where he'd slept for eight hours. Eight highly uncomfortable hours, mostly spent tossing and turning on the sofa due to the fact that he was used to zero gee sleeping areas, where he could literally float.

"Have to ask Zee if we can build a Gravimet room tonight," Amadeus reminded himself. He'd already found a few metal plates left over from the installation of the Hare-Link servers inside Tree that would be perfect for turning into Gravimet plates, though he'd have to convince Zee to do the actual work as he had no tools with which to build them himself. Tree ignored Amadeus as he talked to himself, focused instead on the room where Lindesfare and Fenton slept.

Inside that room the two were already beginning to awaken. Fenton's snores were becoming less regular, and Lindesfare's breathing had sped up to almost normal. Now it was a race to see which one would awaken first, as they usually let each other sleep when one got up before the other. Whichever one did arise first would be able to talk to Amadeus in the relative private of Tree. So who gets up first?
1122121111212212122122211212.title: Tree's Concern

choices: The front door opened to admit Zee
11221211112122121221222112121.content:
Lindesfare awoke slowly at first, starting when she realized she wasn't back in her dorm room at Beige University with Rhonda, the large tigress who was her roommate. It came back in a flash, everything that had happened that morning, with Danielle fainting at a sight of new comer not only to Domain, but to the planet Earth itself. Then the chase after him, followed by a meeting with his odd computer companion, and the humans reaction to his new circumstances, which ended with a battle between him and Zee.

Rising from her bed all the memories flooded back, along with all the questions she still had to ask the human, and Zee as well. Looking around she found the Fenton was still asleep hanging by his favorite perch, and Lindesfare decided she didn't want to wake him so she got out of bed as quietly as she could manage, grabbing a set of clothes from atop her dresser that matched the ones she'd worn that morning precisely, though she could see those clothes sitting on the edge of her hamper, waiting for her to take them back with her to the University so she could wash them.

Dressed she opened the door to the bedroom and then closed it so softly that she doubted even Tree could have felt it. Of course when one of the branches in the hall moved to help her straighten her quills she knew that Tree had indeed felt the door close, or at least felt her waking up. Taking the motherly gesture with a stony face Lindesfare turned to face a speaker through which she could hear Tree, which made it the closest thing to a face the smart house had.

"Good evening Tree," she said pleasantly.

"Good evening yourself, Lindesfare. I take it you had a nice sleep?" asked the sentient flora.

"As good as can be expected. I just can't get used to waking up in another bed after sleeping in the dorm though," she told Tree, walking down the hall towards the living room. Entering she found Amadeus, his head down standing in one corner with his foot propped against the wall behind him. At first she thought he might be asleep, but when he looked up at her she saw his eyes were wide open and his face was split by a kindly looking grin.

"Nice to see you up and about," he said to her.

"It's nice to see you're up too. How was your first day in Domain?" she asked him, wondering how well he'd been able to sleep in a strange environment.

"Quite informative. Your father proved to be a wealth of information about this planet, and observing the staff of Hare-Link at work proved to me that Zee and I have at least a few useful skills," he commented, Lindesfare nodding dully in answer for a second, before it hit her what he'd just said, sending a jolt up her quills.

"Wait a minute, you went to dad's house?" she asked, looking at the human in disbelief.

"I did. I awoke some hours ago, and rather than disturb you and Fenton I decided to join Zee in a little personal exploration, which led me to your house, where I got caught by your little sister, who informed your father. I must say Coney is quite an impressive hunter," he said thoughtfully as he got up from his corner and walked over to the couch where he'd slept before, taking a seat and then patting on the other pad, before flinching back and showing that his left hand now sported one of Lindesfare's quills which had been stuck in the seat.

"Ow," he cried out, more in surprise than pain. Lindesfare rushed over to him, afraid he'd hurt himself, but was relieved when he pulled the quill out using his teeth, and then held it in the palm of his right hand.

"Sorry about that. They come out all over the place. My family's learned to be careful around stuff I sit on," she told him, taking the quill and tossing it into a nearby wastebasket.

"I guess I'll have to learn that too, since it's looking like I'm not gonna be going home," said Amadeus. Surprisingly to Lindesfare his voice held no emotion at that statement, whereas she knew she'd be sad if she ever got lost on some alien world. Well actually she was, but she'd been on the alien world so long it was home. The only home she'd ever known really, as she'd crossed over from the human world at such a young age.

"Don't say that. Maybe your people will come and get. I mean there's always a chance right?" she said, trying her best to cheer him up. Amadeus didn't seem to be cheered by her words though, staring at his feet with a distant expression on his face. Sighing deeply he looked her in the face as she sat down next to him and smiled at her, though this time the grin held a cold indifference rather than the kindness it had the first time.

"There's a chance, yes, but not a good one. I'm a Terminal Gamer, and thus a soldier, and as such I know when to root for the long shot, and when to accept something for what it is. This, I can accept. I mean, do you have any idea how many people spend their lives in search of this place?" he said, waving his hand to try an encompass everything, not just the room, but the whole planet.

"Why thank you, I didn't know I was so sought after," inserted Tree, knowing that he wasn't speaking about her, but wanting to put in her thoughts on the subject. Both Lindesfare and Amadeus shared a laugh at that, which had been Tree's intent, so her feelings weren't adversely affected. The laughter died away quickly after that, and for long moments the two just sat in silence, neither knowing what to say next. At last Amadeus decided to lift the dark mood, getting up and walking over to the window.

"Seriously though, I don't mind. This isn't the first time I've been stranded somewhere. Heck, compared to some of the worlds I've visited this place is a paradise," he told Lindesfare, his eyes getting another distant look to them as he stared into the evening sky, the first stars just coming out of the infinite depth of the sky.

"Yeah, a paradise. This is a world that really was worth fighting for," he said. This time his words were not directed at Lindesfare, or Tree, or anyone else near him. Instead his words were intended for people who had left thousands of years ago, and couldn't hear him at all.

"Yes it is," said Lindesfare, getting up to stand beside him and stare at the stars. She'd always felt like she belonged somewhere up there, one of the few non-fliers who did. She'd even made it once, many years ago. Now standing beside her she had a man who'd traveled between those distant dots of light and seen what lay within their glow. So many questions went through her mind that she didn't know which to ask first, instead standing beside Amadeus in silence gazing upward until...
11221211112122121221222112121.title: Talking with Lindesfare

choices: Watching Zee playing a fiddle in the livingroom
112212111121221212212221121211.content:
"Good evening Lindesfa-oh," Fenton said as he walked into the livingroom, stopping as he saw Amadeus and Lindesfare standing outlines in the dying light of the setting sun.

"I forgot we had company," he said, not sure how to take the scene. He trusted Lindesfare not to do anything, and he doubted Amadeus would have tried anything that fast, but he still had dark thoughts regarding them.

"Well, this was nice talking with you, but I do believe the others are expecting us sometime soon. If you two need a moment to get ready I can step outside," offered Amadeus, pointing towards the door. Lindesfare, sensing the agitation of the two men laughed at them, causing Fenton's face to turn red noticeably even through his fur.

"Guys," she said dismissingly, walking over to Fenton and kissing him on his cheek to show her affections were still his before turning back to Amadeus.

"I think we're ready any time you are, but how are you going to get there without being noticed, or does that matter anymore?" she asked, unsure if Amadeus even wanted to hide now that he'd seen a bit of her world.

"It does, but only for now. Once I talk with Zee later and learn what I'm supposed to be I can go out without hiding, but for now I think it might be best if I wore this," he said, holding up the fur cloak and helm, slipping them on without any trouble.

"Nice costume. That's the stuff that was laying by the door this morning wasn't it?" asked Fenton, walking up and sniffing the fur, which he remembered mainly because he'd found the scent odd.

"Yes, it's my warrior's cloak, carved from Fenrir himself," proclaimed Amadeus proudly. Seeing the looks on the faces of his hosts he decided not to extrapolate, feeling it really didn't matter that much anyway.

"Never mind, let's just get back before Zee gets himself into a tight spot," he said, which made Fenton curious.

"What do you mean get back? You went out while we were asleep?" he questioned, and Amadeus nodded.

"Yes. I decided to explore on my own and wandered into Lindesfare's parent's home. I would have gotten out clean had not her little sister found me. Quite a good hunter that Coney," he commented, though Fenton really had no idea how to take the remark. Without waiting for a reply Amadeus put on his helm and hooked the clips into place to hold the cloak to it.

"We also had a discussion about lodging arrangements for Zee and myself. I hear Tree is feeling a bit empty with no one living here, so we were wondering if you wouldn't mind loaning us the spare bedroom, at least until Zee and I get on our feet," said Amadeus off handedly, trying to aim his words at both Fenton and Tree at the same time. Fenton considered his words for a few moments, and agreed that Tree had seemed sad when he'd left the night before, intending on returning to Beige with Lindesfare, though with the blackout and the visitors they'd stayed an extra day.

"I see no reason why you can't. Tree, how would you feel about having visitors for a while?" asked Fenton, who directed his question at the livingroom speaker that connected to Tree and allowed her to speak to him with ease.

"I must admit, it would be nice to have someone to talk to again, but is either you or this Zee person herbivores?" asked Tree, who put up with Kevin only because Fenton asked her to.

"I'm an omnivore, but I'm not to into eating my dwelling place so you don't have to worry about me, and Zee doesn't eat at all," he said, but then snapped his fingers at a half forgotten memory.

"Well that's not true. Zee did eat when he was following the Gourmand, but since then he hasn't eaten a thing as far as I know," said Amadeus, admitting to himself that there were times when Zee and he didn't run together for years at a stretch, normally when Zee had a kid or two to take care of.

"Then I guess it's okay with me," said Tree, a bit giddy. Both Lindesfare and Fenton looked at each other with questioning glances. They truly hadn't thought Tree was that lonely, but her excitement at the prospect of other people living with her proved otherwise.

"Good. I hope I am worthy tenant, Ms. Tree," said Amadeus, bowing at he speaker, even as he moved to the door.

"Now though we really need to be going. I'm not sure I trust Zee alone with anyone yet. He tends to create problems when I'm not around to keep him out of trouble," said Amadeus, remembering how Zee's second kid had resulted from a simple trip to an ambassadorial suite that took less than an hour.

"I guess we should go see everyone while they're up. We'll go back to the college tomorrow," said Lindesfare, announcing their plans to both Tree and Lindesfare, neither having been privy to the decision that the plans represented, but neither objected to the plans.

"Well then, see you again later tonight," said Tree, wagging her top in glee. She'd have people in her again, for a while at least. The three said a few more words of goodbye, but soon found themselves walking down the path that led from Tree to the Dewclaw home, Amadeus setting a brisk pace that Fenton and Lindesfare, who were used to flying, had trouble keeping up with.

"Could you slow down?" asked Fenton at last, gulping in breathes of air.

"I could, but I don't see why. You should be able to outpace me if you took to the air. Lindesfare's father said you two were quite fast," said Amadeus, who didn't understand why the two had been walking in the first place. Lindesfare looked from Fenton to Amadeus, and then went over to Fenton and took his hand.

"Okay then, how about a race. Let's see how fast you can run. Danielle used to tell me that humans could run a mile in four minutes," she said, trying to subtly tell Fenton to try and keep his flight speed down to somewhere near there. Fenton stared at Lindesfare for a few moments before catching on and winking at her.

"Alright, are you ready Amadeus?" he asked grinning. He would keep his speed down to just little faster so that he didn't reach the Dewclaw home too much quicker than Amadeus. Amadeus took the challenge with a grin, walking back to where the two stood and leaning down so that he was standing like he was about to leap forward, his hands serving as supports with his weight mostly distributed towards his front. Nodding he was ready he let Fenton flap his wings twice, getting a little altitude.

"Go!" shouted Lindesfare and the two men took off towards the large tree in the distance. Like a shot Fenton flew forward, hoping to fly high enough to keep a good eye on Amadeus. Once he'd achieved his target height he looked down and back, trying to find Amadeus, but his radar showed no one on the ground in the direction. Lindesfare nudged him slightly and pointed. When Fenton turned his radar to where she indicated he was surprised to find that Amadeus was outpacing him by almost half a mile already.

"Incredible," he exclaimed as he watch Amadeus just seem to fly over the ground, using a leaping stride to cover whole meters at a time. Fenton, not one to be out done, flew faster, dipping his flight path so he could pick up a bit of the speed he'd wasted ascending to his current altitude. It didn't seem to help though as Amadeus looked over his shoulder and just laughed, increasing his own pace which continued to carry him farther away from the flying pair.

At their speed it took them both mere moments to reach the Dewclaw residence, Amadeus arriving almost a full twenty seconds ahead of the two who'd been flying above him, quite a good lead considering the whole run had taken less than three minutes. When Fenton landed he was again gulping in the air, and was slightly frustrated to find that Amadeus did not look like he'd had a hard time at all, his breathe coming regular and even compared to Fenton's own ragged gasps.

"Where-di-d-you-learn," said Fenton through his deep breathes which chopped his words up, he tried to say more but Lindesfare held her arm up to his chest to stop him from falling over from exhaustion, which he'd nearly done trying to speak in his condition.

"I think Fenton wants to ask how you learned to run like that," she told the human, and the bat nodded in confirmation. Amadeus laughed a bit, pushing his hair out of his face and facing the bat.

"Don't feel bad Fenton. I'm used to a higher gravity, so in the one gee of this planet I can run and hit a lot harder than I can normally. When I get used to this though I won't even be able to do this half as well," said Amadeus, a bit mournfully. Lindesfare looked at Fenton with a bit of concern on her face, wondering if Fenton could have even kept up with half that speed, but decided to say nothing, giving the bat a moment to catch his breathe before going to the door and opening it to find the family...
112212111121221212212221121211.title: Race: Amadeus Vs. Fenton

1122121111212212122122211212111.content:
"Hello everyone," proclaimed Lindesfare as the trio entered the house, Fenton still looking a bit pale as he weakly stepped over the threshold.

"What happened?" asked Kell looking at the boy with a concern that was mirrored on Lindesfare's own face.

"Just a little race Mrs. Dewclaw. Amadeus and I sped the last mile here," said Fenton, trying to stand up straight, but finding that he needed Lindesfare's support just to stand at all.

"Oh, so how badly did you beat him Fenton?" asked Danielle sitting at one end of the table with George at her side and Rudy staring across the table at her.

"I..." said Fenton, trailing off as he tried to find the right way to say that Amadeus on foot had beaten him when he'd been in the air, Amadeus though stepped forward grinning and helping Lindesfare to hold the at up.

"He didn't beat me by that much. Next time I plan on going all out though, so he'd better watch it," said Amadeus, who had somehow acquired a pant himself, and was sweating slightly now. As he helped Lindesfare get Fenton to a seat he winked at the bat out of the corner of his eye, and Fenton returned a weak smile. With Fenton sitting steadily in his chair Lindesfare and Amadeus took the seats to either side of him, and Lindesfare looked around, surprised to find that everyone seemed to be sitting at the table, even though she could hear noises that indicated someone was working in the kitchen.

"Who's cooking tonight?" she queried.

"Well I was going to order some pizza, but Zee insisted on cooking, saying he wanted to show his gratitude for not tossing him and Amadeus out. He insists he downloaded a couple of cook books off the Internet, so we agreed to see what he could do," said Kevin, looking towards Amadeus, silently asking a question he knew the others were all thinking.

"We're in for a treat then. Zee studied the Path of the Gourmand for a while. I think it was more for Vikki than out of any real desire to learn the art, but he picked up more than a few culinary skills," answered Amadeus, chuckling at the memory of Zee asking him if he knew how to cook, and being forced to admit that he'd once burned ice cream.

The others though looked at each other with a bit of concern wondering just what they were in for letting a computer cook for them. They didn't have any time to question Amadeus farther on his companions skills at the culinary arts as the subject of the discussion came into the room, sporting over a dozen plates, and oddly enough an arm for each one.

"Dinner is served," declared the CAP, moving around the table, placing each plate in front of a particular person. No two dishes looked exactly alike, though he seemed to have tried to serve the couples similar looking plates. Stopping at Lindesfare and Fenton he presented to them what looked like two plates covered in various bugs which had been roasted and then seasoned lightly, before moving on to his companion, to whom he gave a bowl full of an odd looking liquid.

"Good to see you could join us Amadeus. Now I hope to fulfill that bet, so that we can start off clean," said Zee to Amadeus just low enough that none of the others could hear what he was saying. Unfortunately they seemed to think the worst of the machine, each of them picking up a fork and poking at the food before them without actually eating anything. Zee didn't notice though as he looked to Amadeus expectantly.

Wanting to show the others that the food was safe, and to show Zee that he trusted him he picked up a spoon and took a mouthful of his soup. Everywhere around the table the others stopped even trying to look interested in their own dishes to stare at Amadeus, who's face changed into a hurt expression as the soup touched his tongue. For a moment everyone was afraid that the human might be dying, but then with a sharp exhalation he breathed out not just air but also a small wisp of smoke.

"Woah. There's a kicker. How'd you make Vidaran Spice Soup here Zee?" asked Amadeus breathlessly. Taking another spoon full of the odd multicolor liquid, his face scrunching up in pain as he did so, he then placed his hands before his mouth while looking at the CAP.

"Vidarans created the Spice Soup using only terrestrial ingredients Amadeus, just much differently than anyone had back home. Even the smoke pellets are a simple chemical trick," answered Zee, smiling as Amadeus breathed another wisp of smoke into his cup hands. Closing them tightly before any of the smoke could escape Amadeus squeezed his palms together oddly, and then when he released them a cloud that looked like a butterfly floated in front of him.

"Well they invented something great, and you do their dishes honor Gourmand Zee," said Amadeus, his voice a bit raspy from the spice in the soup. Looking at his smoke sculpture he breathed out one last bit of smoke that pierced the butterfly and collapsed it into a formless cloud that quickly vanished. Everyone took a moment to stare as Zee bowed at the complement before turning to them.

Wondering what had just passed between the two they each faced their own food, and almost as one they each took a testing bite of the food. Silence permeated the room for several moments as everyone took in the flavor of their food, and then Rudy interrupted it by diving at his plate, tearing into the food like... well like a wolf.

"I take it my food meets with approval?" asked Zee, looking at everyone as they each continued to eat their meals, some savoring every bite, while Rudy and others ripped into theirs. Amadeus, who was still trying to get through his soup a single spoonful at a time leaned close to his companion.

"I think you can take that as a yes," he said, and Zee nodded. He bowed again, taking the silence and the fact that they were eating his dishes as complements in and of themselves, as he'd been taught to do by his master on the Path of the Gourmand.

The rest of the meal passed without another word spoken, though Rudy belched loudly once, only to have Amadeus belch even louder in response, earning the human a pointed look from Zee and the women, but an approving one from the males who sat at the table with him. When at last not one scrape of food remained the group was silent again, while Zee took each of the plates away as each person finished their particular meals.

The sounds of clinking plates and running water came from the kitchen, and when Zee emerged again his body looked like one of Kell's family again without all the extra arms. Everyone was content to just sit at the table for several silent minutes, looking at the last few smoke images forged by Amadeus before they faded away into nothingness.

"I declare this meal a success," proclaimed Zee as he walked towards the livingroom, and the group, Amadeus included, nodded their agreement as they followed him.

"You are quite a talented chef Zee. You'll have to teach me that recipe you used to bring out the flavor of that veal," said Kell as everyone took the seats they'd had last night, though with Bruno and Corrie sitting on the floor near Ralph and Martha. Lindesfare and Fenton pointed at the tesseract as they entered the room, looking at the odd sculpture and pointing.

"What is that?" asked Fenton as he took his seat.

"Something Amadeus made from Coney's bone stash," answered Kevin as he let his eyes fall on the sculpture as well. He lost himself in the almost infinite depth of the cube-within-a-cube design before looking away. Lindesfare and Fenton stared into the sculpture themselves, excited to find that the inner cube didn't seem to move no matter how they moved their heads.

"Ingenious, a tesseract," said Lindesfare, identifying the shape from a drawing one of her teachers had once shown her. Amadeus looked towards Zee with a surprised expression which the CAP returned as they both faced Lindesfare.

"You know what a tesseract is?" asked Amadeus, stunned that one of his hosts recognized the three dimensional representation of a four dimensional figure.

"Well, kinda. My professor talked about it once, but she didn't seem to know much. I looked it up after class, but about all I know is that it has something to do with four dimensions of space," she admitted, but both Zee and Amadeus remained surprised. They hadn't thought the science of the new dominate species of Earth had evolved far enough to recognize four spacial dimensions, let alone express them.

"That is correct. A tesseract is a basic four-d shape. It is to a cube, what the cube is to a square," commented Zee as he stared at the hedgehog with renewed interest.

"Yeah, that's what it said online, but your model of it looks much more advanced," she said staring at the sculpture. Amadeus, seeing Zee's expression pinched the CAP causing him to start in surprise and pain alike, and focusing his attention on a very mad looking Amadeus, who silently admonished his brother not to stare at their hosts.

"Eh, it's just the shape the bones wanted to take. They could have just as easily taken the form of a clown," said Amadeus dismissively, trying to make the conversation turn from the odd sculpture, while wishing he hadn't made it, and hoping that he could destroy it sometime later without anyone noticing.

"They could have, but they did not," said Zee, trying to keep the conversation alive, but by then everyone was staring at the pair, and they were forced to chuckle embarrassedly. After that the conversation turned towards what the two would do the following day, with Zee agreeing to come by the Dewclaw's and see what he could do with the Hare-Link server while Kell took Amadeus to Herd Thinners and showed him around.

Zee informed both Amadeus and the group that in the files he'd created Amadeus was listed as a species of lemur that was indigenous to a single island. Luckily the lemurs were few in number, so few would know one, while at the same time they were listed as being wanderers, meaning Amadeus' current location would not be too hard to explain. With the business of the newcomers covered the group was then informed that Fenton and Lindesfare would be returning to Beige University tomorrow, and that Amadeus and Zee would be taking up residence within Tree. Just after that declaration of plans Rudy let out a deep yawn, which spread through the group like a wave, causing everyone but Zee, Amadeus, Fenton, and Lindesfare to yawn as well.

"I'm guessing it's bed time for most of you. So how about me, Zee, and the lovely couple go back to Tree and start getting ready for tomorrow. I have some questions for Tree which I think she and I need to work out," said Amadeus, and many of the others nodded their tired agreement. Goodbyes were brief as Fiona hugged Rudy, Bruno hugged Corrie, and then both girls went off with Martha and Ralph towards a large building in the distance which was Fiona's mansion according to what Amadeus had been told, though why the youngest of the four owned the dwelling in which they lived he had no idea.

Being the next group to leave the four going to Tree said their piece with those staying at the Dewclaw's, Fenton promising Kevin to look after Lindesfare, and Kell getting Lindesfare to promise to keep out of trouble and to look after Fenton too. With those goodbyes said the group walked to the door, and Amadeus looked down at his cloak, realizing he now had a choice of whether or not to wear it. Does he wear it?
1122121111212212122122211212111.title: Dinner with the Dewclaws

11221211112122121221222112121112.content:
Picking up the fur cloak Amadeus tossed it over his shoulder, though he did end up putting on the helm, which he felt actually went with his gray polymer weave skin suit more than it ever had with the fur cloak.
